      public static java.lang.String joinListGrammatically​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
      Converts a list of strings to a comma-separated list, using "and" for the last item.
      Parameters:
      list - the list to convert
      Returns:
      the resultant string

    • createSortedMap

      public static <T> java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​T> createSortedMap​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​T> map)
      Create a Map using the elements from the given map, with their keys sorted using the sorted name as returned by getSortingString(String).
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type of map entries
      Parameters:
      map - Map containing elements to be sorted by the keys
      Returns:
      A sorted Map containing the elements from the give map

    • compareSortingStrings

      public static int compareSortingStrings​(java.lang.String str1, java.lang.String str2)
      Compare the given 2 Strings using the sorted name as returned by getSortingString(String).
      Parameters:
      str1 - First string for comparison
      str2 - Second string for comparison
      Returns:
      a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the sorting name of str1 is less than, equal to, or greater than the sorting name of str2.

    • getSortingString

      public static java.lang.String getSortingString​(java.lang.String orig)
      The 'numero lexi sorting name' is a munged version of a string that 'zero fills' its numeric portions. This can be used to ensure "member2foo" sorts before "member12foo" as these would munge to "member000002foo" and "member000012foo".

      Handles up to 20 digits... - otherwise it doesn't zero fill...

      Parameters:
      orig - original value
      Returns:
      munged value
